sections.content: I’m Cedric Arnhold, 21 years old, and I study Business Informatics at the University of Applied Sciences for Technology and Economics in Berlin. I program a few things on the side that come to mind, such as this website. Currently, I am doing my mandatory internship at the BMDV, where I have gained my first experiences in system administration and server infrastructure through an intensive crash course in just three months. At the moment, I’m receiving a lot of input both from the BMDV and in my private life, as I not only run this website but also manage my father’s website, ensuring that it displays correctly on all kinds of devices. Additionally, I am working on reviving and modernizing my old university project, VirtualPet. The next major project is already on the horizon: a private email, web, and cloud server for my father. I look forward to sharing more about my projects and experiences in the future

Our adventure began on a clear morning in Berlin. Riding our Vespa Primavera 50, we embarked on an almost two-month tour through northern Germany. From Berlin through Swinemünde, Rügen, Lübeck, Kiel to Flensburg and Ribe, we discovered picturesque coastal towns and cozy cafés. A highlight was the two-week stop at my grandparents’ in Brunsbüttel, where we recharged.

On our return from Brunsbüttel to Berlin, unexpected challenges arose. In Wolfsburg, I fell ill and we narrowly avoided a dangerous detour onto the Autobahn. Passing through Bremerhaven, Bremen, Celle and the breathtaking Harz, we finally spent a week in the Erzgebirge with my girlfriend’s grandmother. A sudden drop in temperature and heavy rain forced us to end the tour a few days early.
